sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Why Redwire Stocks Are Rising
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation (NYSE: RDW) stocks are experiencing significant movement, with a 9% daily surge driven by investor excitement and strategic partnerships despite a -7.42% downtrend and bankruptcy concerns. The company shows robust revenue growth and technological innovation in the aerospace sector, but faces profitability challenges and cost concerns highlighted in recent financial reports. Analysts forecast a promising trajectory for Redwire, emphasizing its market capture and global expansion initiatives.

feed.title: Redwire (NYSE:RDW) Trading Down 5.4% - Here's What Happened
feed.summary: Redwire (NYSE: RDW) shares saw a 5.4% decline on Friday, trading at $7.3990 with significantly lower than average trading volume. The stock is currently below its 200-day moving average but above its 50-day moving average, with analysts holding a "Hold" consensus rating and a target price of $12.50. Despite the recent dip, company insiders have been actively purchasing shares, increasing their overall ownership to 2.60%.

feed.title: Redwire (NYSE:RDW) Shares Gap Down - Should You Sell?
feed.summary: Redwire (NYSE:RDW) shares gapped down on Tuesday, opening at $8.17 after closing at $8.52, with a trading volume of over 1.6 million shares. Despite this, MarketBeat shows a consensus "Hold" rating with a $12.50 price target, and recent insider buying by the CEO and CAO suggests some confidence. Analysts remain split, with some maintaining buy ratings while others have trimmed price targets.

feed.title: Redwire to Provide Spacecraft Docking Systems for TEC’s European Space Capsule, ‘NYX’
feed.summary: Redwire has secured an eight-figure deal to supply two International Berthing and Docking Mechanisms (IBDM) for The Exploration Company's (TEC) 'Nyx' European space capsule. This agreement will enable Nyx's autonomous rendezvous and docking capabilities, supporting Europe's ambition for independent space access. The IBDM system is crucial for the future operations of TEC’s flagship spacecraft.

feed.title: Why Is Redwire (RDW) Stock Soaring Today
feed.summary: Redwire's stock jumped 5.7% following an announcement of an "eight-figure deal" with European aerospace firm The Exploration Company for advanced docking systems. This marks the third consecutive day of gains for RDW, driven by the significant contract valued at a minimum of $10 million and positive sentiment around space-related stocks. Despite the recent rally, Redwire shares are still down 49.8% year-to-date and trading significantly below their 52-week high.

feed.title: Redwire (RDW) Stock News Today: European Nyx Docking Deal, DARPA VLEO Catalyst, and Analyst Price Targets (Dec. 22, 2025)
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation (NYSE: RDW) has seen a significant rally driven by an eight-figure European spacecraft docking contract for The Exploration Company’s Nyx capsule program, alongside a $44 million DARPA VLEO mission contract and the acquisition of Edge Autonomy. Analysts have mixed views, with consensus price targets implying upside, but the stock remains a high-uncertainty equity due to execution risks, ongoing losses, and significant volatility. Investors are closely watching the follow-through on the Nyx program, DARPA Otter milestones, and the company's path to consistent profitability.

feed.title: Voya Investment Management LLC Buys New Position in Redwire Corporation $RDW
feed.summary: Voya Investment Management LLC has acquired a new position in Redwire Corporation, purchasing over 2.2 million shares valued at about $20.37 million. Analyst sentiment for Redwire is mixed, with an average "Hold" rating and a consensus price target of $12.50, despite recent insider buying activity. The company's stock shows a beta of 2.48 and a market cap of $1.32 billion, with insiders owning 2.60% of the shares.

feed.title: Redwire Tapped to Provide Docking Mechanisms for Nyx Earth Capsule
feed.summary: Redwire has secured a contract from The Exploration Company to provide two International Berthing and Docking Mechanisms (IBDM) for its Nyx cargo spacecraft. These docking systems, to be utilized on the Nyx Earth demonstration flight to the ISS in 2028, will support Europe's growing commercial space sector. This marks Redwire's second IBDM contract in 2025, highlighting its significant role in facilitating both ISS and future Lunar Gateway missions.

feed.title: Redwire Corporation Stock (RDW) Surges on European Docking Deal: Today’s News, Analyst Forecasts, and Key Risks (Dec. 19, 2025)
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation (RDW) stock surged after announcing an "eight-figure" agreement to provide standardized docking systems for The Exploration Company's Nyx spacecraft. This deal is significant as it demonstrates crucial commercial and international expansion for Redwire, positioning its docking hardware as foundational for the expanding space economy. While analysts have mixed views, emphasizing both growth potential and concerns about cash burn and potential dilution, the contract highlights genuine demand for space infrastructure.

feed.title: Why Redwire (RDW) Stock Is Trading Up Today
feed.summary: Redwire's stock jumped 11.8% after announcing an eight-figure agreement with The Exploration Company (TEC) to provide advanced spacecraft docking systems. This deal involves supplying two International Docking System Standard (IDSS) compliant docking systems for TEC's Nyx spacecraft. Additionally, Keybanc analyst Michael Leshock initiated coverage on Redwire with a 'Sector Weight' rating.

feed.title: Redwire Secures $44 Million DARPA Contract Boosting Space-Tech Ambitions
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation has been awarded a $44 million contract by DARPA for its Otter VLEO mission, which includes developing the world's first air-breathing spacecraft using its SabreSat design. This news caused Redwire's shares to surge by 9% in premarket trading and led Cantor Fitzgerald to revise its price target to $9. The contract not only provides a financial boost but also solidifies Redwire's position as a pioneer in advanced space technology, despite the company's current negative profit margins.

feed.title: Redwire To Deliver Docking Elements For The Exploration Company’s Nyx
feed.summary: Redwire has secured a multi-million-dollar contract with The Exploration Company to supply docking systems for its Nyx spacecraft. This agreement includes two International Berthing and Docking Mechanism systems, which are compliant with the International Docking System Standard. The details of this contract were announced on December 18.

feed.title: Redwire stock soars after securing major spacecraft docking deal
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation (NYSE:RDW) saw its stock surge 11% after announcing an eight-figure deal with The Exploration Company (TEC) to supply advanced docking systems for TEC's Nyx spacecraft. These International Berthing and Docking Mechanism (IBDM) systems will enable autonomous rendezvous and docking, expanding Redwire's presence in the European space sector. The deal highlights Redwire's contribution to Europe's commercial space initiatives and positions its technology for future standardization.

feed.title: Redwire stock soars after securing major spacecraft docking deal
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation (NYSE:RDW) stock surged 11% on Thursday following the announcement of an eight-figure deal with The Exploration Company (TEC). Redwire will provide advanced International Berthing and Docking Mechanism (IBDM) systems for TEC’s Nyx spacecraft, expanding Redwire's presence in the European commercial space sector. This strategic partnership highlights Redwire's technology for autonomous rendezvous and docking capabilities, aligning with TEC's mission for affordable and sustainable space cargo transit.

feed.title: Redwire Awarded Contract to Provide Spacecraft Docking Systems for The Exploration Company's European Space Capsule
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation has secured an eight-figure contract to supply International Docking System Standard (IDSS) compliant docking systems for The Exploration Company's Nyx spacecraft. This agreement aims to bolster Europe's autonomous access to space by integrating Redwire's IBDM system, which supports autonomous rendezvous and docking capabilities. The collaboration between the two companies will enhance Nyx's architecture for future commercial and institutional missions.

feed.title: Redwire Corporation's (NYSE:RDW) P/S Is Still On The Mark Following 27% Share Price Bounce
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation (NYSE:RDW) has seen its share price bounce by 27% in the last month, though it remains down 49% over the past year. Despite its high price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 3.8x compared to an industry average of 3.1x, analysts forecast a 49% revenue growth for Redwire in the coming year, significantly outpacing the industry's 10% projection. This strong growth outlook contributes to its elevated P/S ratio and suggests investors expect continued improvement.

feed.title: Redwire Corporation's (NYSE:RDW) P/S Is Still On The Mark Following 27% Share Price Bounce
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation's stock has rebounded 27% in the last month, though it's still down 49% over the past year. Despite a high price-to-sales ratio of 3.8x compared to the industry, analysts forecast significant revenue growth of 49% for Redwire in the coming year, justifying its valuation. The company's P/S ratio reflects investor confidence in its future prospects, despite recent short-term revenue stagnation.

feed.title: Redwire (RDW) Is Up 14.1% After $44 Million DARPA Deal and Space Data Center Buzz - What's Changed

This deal reinforces Redwire's position in very low Earth orbit solutions, supporting its growth in defense and space programs. feed.title: Redwire Corporation $RDW Shares Acquired by AE Industrial Partners LP
feed.summary: AE Industrial Partners LP significantly increased its stake in Redwire Corporation (NYSE:RDW) by 139.3% in Q2, now holding 85.5 million shares, representing approximately 59.36% ownership. feed.title: Redwire Faces Industry Challenges as Analysts Slash Price Targets
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation (RDW) is facing significant financial and market challenges, leading analysts like Canaccord and BofA to slash price targets and maintain Underperform ratings. The company reported underperforming Q3 results with deeply negative profit margins and substantial net income losses, signaling operational inefficiencies and liquidity constraints. The article highlights that RDW's near-term outlook is challenging, requiring substantial operational and cost adjustments for recovery and growth.

feed.title: BofA Doubles Down on Redwire with Price Target Reduction
feed.summary: BofA has reduced its price target for Redwire Corporation (RDW) and maintained an Underperform rating due to market volatility, recent financial shortcomings in Q3, and anticipated challenges from a potential US government shutdown. The company exhibits weak profitability with negative EBIT and EBITDA margins despite revenue growth, highlighting systemic operational inefficiencies. This negative outlook is compounded by investor hesitancy and bearish sentiments, suggesting a need for strategic shifts to navigate industry consolidation.

feed.title: Redwire (RDW) Receives a Buy from Cantor Fitzgerald
feed.summary: Cantor Fitzgerald analyst Colin Canfield reiterated a Buy rating on Redwire (RDW) and set a price target of $9.00. The company recently reported a quarterly revenue of $103.43 million with a GAAP net loss of $41.15 million, and insider sentiment on the stock is neutral.

feed.title: Redwire’s Recent 34% Surge Versus DCF and Sales Metrics in 2025
feed.summary: Redwire (NYSE: RDW) has seen its stock jump significantly but remains down year-to-date, with traditional valuation metrics suggesting it is currently overvalued. A Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis estimates an intrinsic value of $0.87 per share, implying the stock is 755.2% overvalued compared to its recent price of $7.50. Furthermore, its price-to-sales ratio of 4.17x is well above the industry average and its calculated "Fair Ratio" of 1.72x, indicating a premium not fully supported by fundamentals.

feed.title: Why Redwire (RDW) Stock Is Trading Lower Today
feed.summary: Shares of aerospace and defense company Redwire (RDW) fell 1.3% after Cantor Fitzgerald significantly lowered its price target by 55% to $9.00, while maintaining an "Overweight" rating. This substantial cut reflects a more cautious stance on Redwire's future, concerning investors. The stock's volatility is noted, with its current trading price significantly below its 52-week high, and investors who bought at IPO in 2021 are now seeing a loss.

Their expertise includes essential structures and components for satellites, spacecraft, and exploration systems.

feed.title: Redwire Corporation (RDW) Stock Outlook – December 8, 2025: Can a High‑Risk Space–Defense Bet Really Double from Here?
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation (RDW) is a small-cap space and defense technology company experiencing significant volatility. Despite a 75% drop from its 52-week high, Wall Street analysts project a 100-125% upside, though ratings remain cautious due to cash burn, dilution, and legal scrutiny. The company's future hinges on resolving government contract delays, successful execution of its Edge Autonomy segment, and achieving profitability to validate its high-risk, high-reward potential.

feed.title: Why Redwire stock collapsed 30% last month
feed.summary: The Redwire (NYSE: RDW) stock price experienced a significant 30% decline last month, attributed to the company's disappointing third-quarter earnings report. Despite increasing revenue, the substantial net loss of $25 million and a negative free cash flow of $35.4 million raised investor concerns. Analysts remain cautiously optimistic about Redwire's long-term prospects, citing new contract wins and a growing backlog.

feed.title: Redwire wins $44M DARPA contract to advance VLEO mission
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation has been awarded a $44 million Phase 2 contract by DARPA for the Otter Very Low Earth Orbit (VLEO) mission. This contract funds the manufacturing and delivery of an air-breathing spacecraft based on Redwire’s SabreSat platform. The mission aims to demonstrate next-generation orbital capabilities, improving sensor perception, proximity to targets, and mission resilience at lower altitudes.

feed.title: Redwire Wins $44M DARPA Contract for VLEO Demo
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation secured a $44 million Phase 2 contract from DARPA to develop a Very Low Earth Orbit (VLEO) satellite, featuring air-breathing electric propulsion (ABEP) technology. This initiative is part of DARPA's Otter program, aiming for a year-long VLEO flight between 90 and 250 km altitude. Redwire will integrate the ABEP system onto its SabreSat platform, demonstrating the technology's potential for extended missions in an orbit that offers benefits like lower latency for communications and higher resolution for Earth observation.

feed.title: Canaccord Genuity Slashes Redwire Corporation’s (RDW) Price Target To $11, Keeps Buy Rating
feed.summary: Canaccord Genuity has cut its price target for Redwire Corporation (RDW) to $11 from $17.50, while maintaining a Buy rating, following the company's Q3 results which missed revenue and profit estimates and a lowered full-year guidance. Other firms like Truist Securities and Cantor Fitzgerald also revised their price targets. Despite a significant year-to-date share plunge, Wall Street analysts still hold a consensus Buy rating for RDW, with a median share price target of $14.

feed.title: These Analysts Think Redwire Corporation's (NYSE:RDW) Sales Are Under Threat
feed.summary: Analysts have downgraded Redwire Corporation's future revenue forecasts for 2026, lowering expectations to US$517m from US$589m, representing a substantial cut and a more pessimistic outlook. This downgrade also led to a 21% reduction in the consensus price target to US$14.00, despite expectations for Redwire's growth to outpace the industry. The article suggests investors should be cautious due to this shift in sentiment and potential issues like stock dilution.

feed.title: Redwire Corporation Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation announced its financial results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025, with revenues increasing by 50.7% year-over-year to $103.4 million. Despite a net loss of $(41.2) million, the company achieved an Adjusted Gross Margin of 27.1% and a Book-to-Bill ratio of 1.25, demonstrating strengthened positioning after the acquisition of Edge Autonomy. Redwire anticipates continued revenue growth and improved free cash flow, forecasting full-year revenues of $320 million to $340 million, although key awards may be delayed into 2026 due to the U.S. government shutdown.

feed.title: Why Redwire Corporation Stock Just Crashed
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation stock crashed 7.5% following the announcement of its CFO's retirement and a major stakeholder's intent to sell nearly 10 million shares. Despite this sell-off, the article suggests that the company's underlying business is still growing and that the management change appears orderly. The author concludes that the stock's plunge could present a buying opportunity, contrasting with the negative market reaction.

feed.title: Can Redwire’s (RDW) New Board Additions Shift Its Competitive Edge in Space and Defense?
feed.summary: Redwire (RDW) recently announced board and CFO changes, including the departure of John Bolton and Jonathan Baliff, and new appointments: General (RET) James McConville and Dorothy D. Hayes as directors, and Chris Edmunds as CFO. These changes, alongside recent contract wins like the Axiom Space deal, aim to strengthen governance and expand Redwire's position in the defense and commercial space sectors. The article examines how these leadership changes and business developments could influence Redwire’s investment outlook, particularly in navigating growth opportunities and managing execution risks in government and commercial contracts.

feed.title: Redwire Corporation (NYSE:RDW) Receives Average Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" from Brokerages - MarketBeat
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation (NYSE:RDW) has received an average "Moderate Buy" rating from brokerages, based on ratings from ten firms. The company's stock has an average 12-month price target of $17.2143. Recent financial performance indicates missed earnings estimates and declining revenue, alongside significant insider selling and varied institutional investor activity.

feed.title: Redwire and Red Cat Announce Strategic Drone Integration Concept to Meet Multiple US Army Echelon Needs
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation and Red Cat announced a strategic partnership to integrate Red Cat’s Teal Drones Black Widow with Edge Autonomy’s Stalker UAS. This integration aims to provide advanced surveillance, reconnaissance, and situational awareness for U.S. Army echelon missions. The combined system allows the Stalker to act as a carrier and launch platform for the Black Widow, extending mission range and providing critical data for warfighters.

feed.title: Redwire Corp. Experiences Revision in Stock Evaluation Amid Market Fluctuations - Markets Mojo
feed.summary: Redwire Corp., a small-cap Aerospace & Defense company, has seen its stock evaluation revised amid significant market fluctuations. Despite strong short-term performance, including a 25.64% return over the past week and 34.86% over one month, the stock is down 31.83% year-to-date and shows mixed technical indicators with bearish trends in MACD and moving averages, contrasting with a bullish Bollinger Bands outlook monthly. Over a three-year period, Redwire has achieved remarkable growth of 299.29%, significantly outperforming the S&P 500.

feed.title: Redwire receives $45M AFRL contract - Albuquerque Business First
feed.summary: Redwire, through its LoadPath company, has secured a $45 million contract from the Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL). The contracted work will be performed in Albuquerque, New Mexico. This highlights Redwire's continued involvement in significant government and defense projects.

feed.title: Private equity firms among Redwire Corporation's (NYSE:RDW) largest shareholders, saw gain in holdings value after stock jumped 11% last week
feed.summary: Private equity firms, particularly AE Industrial Partners, LP, are Redwire Corporation's largest shareholders, holding 61% of the company. Their holdings saw a significant gain after Redwire's stock jumped 11% last week, increasing the market cap by US$92 million. Institutional investors own 15% of the company, while the general public holds 22%, and insiders own 23 million USD worth of shares.

feed.title: Redwire Supplies Roll-Out Solar Arrays for Thales Space Inspire Line
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation has received a follow-on order from Thales Alenia Space for additional Roll-Out Solar Array (ROSA) wings, increasing the total number of shipsets for Thales's Space Inspire line of satellites. These software-defined Geostationary Orbit (GEO) telecommunications satellites are fully reprogrammable in orbit, allowing operators to adjust capacity allocations. Redwire's ROSA wings are also used on the International Space Station and will support Blue Origin's Blue Ring platform.

feed.title: Redwire breaks ground on microgravity payload development and space ops facility
feed.summary: Redwire Corporation officially broke ground on a new 30,000 square foot microgravity payload development and space operations facility in Floyd County, Indiana. This state-of-the-art facility will support Redwire's space biotechnology programs, including bioprinting human tissue and growing pharmaceutical crystals in space, to meet the increasing demand for in-space research and manufacturing. The company has already seen significant on-orbit successes with its 3D BioFabrication Facility (BFF) and Pharmaceutical In-space Laboratory (PIL-BOX) platforms.

feed.title: Redwire to break ground on Floyd County operations center
feed.summary: Redwire Corp. is set to break ground on a new 30,000-square-foot microgravity payload development facility in Floyd County, Indiana, which is expected to create 25 new jobs. This facility will expand Redwire's capabilities in in-space manufacturing and microgravity research, including projects like 3D bioprinting human tissue and developing platforms for growing pharmaceutical crystals in partnership with Eli Lilly and Co. Construction on the Novaparke Innovation & Technology Campus site is anticipated to take about 15 months.

feed.title: Redwire teams up with Korea’s Boryung on Space Biotech
feed.summary: Redwire ($RDW), a space infrastructure company, is partnering with Boryung, a Korean health investment fund, to conduct new human health investigations on the International Space Station (ISS). This collaboration will involve Boryung's third annual Humans in Space contest, allowing researchers to propose microgravity experiments to be executed by Redwire on the ISS, potentially starting in 2025. Redwire, which already has ten bioprinting and research facilities on the ISS, aims to expand the space biotech ecosystem through this partnership.
